original: Carling, Oscar Herman, kontraktsprost, kyrkoherde emeritus, Borgholm, f. 19/1/76 i Rumskulla, Kalmar 1., av lantbr. Carl Johansson o. Katarina Jonsson. G. 02 m. Louise Norman, d. 43. Barn: Ruth f. 03. — Stud:ex. 96, teol. fil. ex. 99, teor. teol. ex. Oil, prästv. s. å. Past:adj. i Löt 01, kommin. i Högby 02, domkyrkoadj. i Kalmar 16, pred. v. fattigv :inrättn. o. las. där 17, kyrkoh. i Ölmstad 18, kontr :prost i Vista kontr. 26-28, kyrkoh. i Borgholm 28, las :pred. där 29, badpred. v. Lundsbrunn 23’-24, i Borgholm 29-31, kontr :prost i Ölands n. kontr. 43, emer. 46. Insp. f. komm. mellansk. 31-46, diakonistyr. stiftsomb. 13-21, Växjö stiftsråds omb. 21-28, ordf. i kyrkostämma 18-38, led. av o. ordf. i kyrko-fullm. sed. 39, ordf. i folksk:styr. sed. 30, omb. f. miss :styr. i Växjö stift 25-36, ordf. i djurskyddsfören. 29-39, ordf. o. kassör i und :stödsfören. Senapskornet 28-39, ordf. i barnav :ndn i Ölmstad 18-28, led. av tax:ndn, dess ordf. Skr.: art. i tidn. o. tidskr. LVO.
translated: Carling, Oscar Herman, senior minister, retired vicar, Borgholm, born January 19, 1876, in Rumskulla, Kalmar County, son of farmer Carl Johansson and Katarina Jonsson. Married in 1902 to Louise Norman, who died in 1943. They had one child, Ruth, born in 1903. Carling obtained his degree of Studentexamen in 1896, his degree of Theology in 1899, his degree of Theoretical Theology in 1901, and became a priest in the same year. He served as assistant pastor in Löt in 1901, as curate in Högby in 1902, and as cathedral assistant in Kalmar in 1916. He was a preacher at the poorhouse and hospital in Kalmar in 1917, a vicar in Ölmstad in 1918, a senior district cleric in Vista district from 1926 to 1928, a vicar in Borgholm in 1928, a hospital preacher there in 1929, and a senior district cleric in North Öland district in 1943 before retiring in 1946. Additionally, he was responsible for inspecting the school district from 1931 to 1946, served as the diakonistyr. diocese representative from 1913 to 1921, the Växjö stiftsråd representative from 1921 to 1928, and was chairman of the church assembly from 1918 to 1938, a member and chairman of the church council since 1939. He was also the chairman of the primary school board since 1930, the Växjö diocese representative for the mission committee from 1925 to 1936, the chairman of the animal protection association from 1929 to 1939, and the chairman and treasurer for the supporting association Senapskornet from 1928 to 1939. He was the chairman of the Ölmstad children’s committee from 1918 to 1928, a member of the tax committee and its chairman. He also wrote articles for newspapers and magazines. LVO.
